verses.text: 與基督同死同活這樣，我們可以說甚麼呢？我們可以常在罪中，叫恩典增多嗎？

words.note: Refers to Jesus Christ.
Figurative: dying to sin.
Figurative: living a new life.
Used as a suffix to denote 'within' or 'amidst'.
Refers to divine grace.

verses.text: 絕對不可！我們向罪死了的人，怎麼可以仍然活在罪中呢？

words.note: Used as a suffix to denote 'within' or 'amidst'.

verses.text: 難道你們不曉得我們這受洗歸入基督耶穌的人，是受洗歸入他的死嗎？
所以我們藉著洗禮歸入死，與他同葬，為的是要我們過新生命的生活，像基督藉著父的榮耀從死人中復活一樣。

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of

words.note: Refers to Jesus Christ.
Refers to God the Father.
Used as a suffix to denote 'within' or 'among'.

verses.text: 我們若在他死的樣式上與他聯合，也要在他復活的樣式上與他聯合。

words.note: Indicates 'on' or 'in the aspect of'.
Here used as a noun, 'his resurrection'.
Indicates 'on' or 'in the aspect of'.

verses.text: 我們知道，我們的舊人已經與基督同釘十字架，使罪身喪失機能，使我們不再作罪的奴僕，

words.note: Refers to one's unregenerate sinful nature.
Common in biblical context.

verses.text: 因為死了的人已經脫離罪了。
我們既然與基督同死，就信也必與他同活。
我們知道，基督既然從死人中復活，就不再死，死也不再轄制他了。

words.note: Often found in classical or religious texts.

verses.text: 他死，是向罪死了，只有這一次；他活，是向　神活著。
你們也應當這樣，向罪算自己是死的，在基督耶穌裡，向　神卻是活的。

words.note: A core concept in Christian theology.
Combines 'Christ' (anointed one) and 'Jesus'.
The preceding space is a reverential mark in some Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 所以，不要容罪在你們必死的肉身上掌權，使你們順從肉身的私慾，

words.note: Refers to the physical body, often associated with human weakness or sin in biblical contexts.
Implies inappropriate or selfish desires, distinct from neutral 'desire'.

verses.text: 也不要把你們的肢體獻給罪，作不義的用具；倒要像出死得生的人，把自己獻給　神，並且把你們的肢體獻給　神作義的用具。

words.note: In a biblical context, can also refer to members of the church as one body.
Common in religious contexts, implying a solemn act of dedication.
A theological phrase describing spiritual regeneration.
A key theological term, meaning moral uprightness or justice.

verses.text: 罪必不能轄制你們，因為你們不是在律法之下，而是在恩典之下。

words.note: Implies strict, often oppressive control.
Often refers to the Mosaic Law or the principles of divine law.
Undeserved divine favor, a cornerstone of Christian theology.

verses.text: 作義的奴僕那卻怎麼樣呢？我們不在律法之下，而在恩典之下，就可以犯罪嗎？絕對不可！

words.note: Implies complete dedication and submission, often used metaphorically for service to God.

verses.text: 難道你們不知道你們自願作奴僕去順從人，順從誰就作誰的奴僕，或作罪的奴僕以致於死，或作順從的奴僕以致於義嗎？

words.definition: could it be that; do you mean to say
words.note: Used to form a rhetorical question.

words.definition: voluntarily, of one's own free will

words.note: Indicates purpose or direction of action.
Contextually refers to spiritual death.

verses.text: 感謝　神，你們雖然作過罪的奴僕，現在卻從心裡順從了傳授給你們的教義的規範。

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence for God's name.
過 (guò) indicates past experience or completion.

verses.text: 你們既然從罪裡得了釋放，就作了義的奴僕。

words.note: Often used with 從 as 從…裡 to mean 'from within'.

verses.text: 因為你們肉體的弱點，我就按一般人的話來說，你們從前怎樣把你們的肢體獻給不潔和不法作奴僕，以致於不法，現在也要照樣把你們的肢體獻給義作奴僕，以致於成聖。

words.note: Used with 說 (shuō) to mean 'to speak of it'.

verses.text: 你們作罪的奴僕的時候，就不受義的約束。
那麼，你們在現今以為羞恥的事上，當時得了甚麼呢？那些事的結局就是死。

words.note: Combines two characters meaning 'shame'.

verses.text: 現在你們既然從罪裡得了釋放，作了　神的奴僕，就有成聖的果子，那結局就是永生。

words.note: Refers to the Christian God.
A theological term meaning 'to become holy'.
A key concept in Christian theology.

verses.text: 因為罪的工價就是死，但　神的恩賞，在我們的主基督耶穌裡，卻是永生。

words.note: Refers to the Christian God.
God's gift or reward of grace.
Refers to Jesus Christ.
A key concept in Christian theology.
